p.seg: EXTENSION BULLETIN NO. 86. The University of Nebraska. BULLETIN OF THE AGRICULTURAL EXPERIMENT STATION OF NEBRASKA. rECTORY OF NEBRASKA DAIRY CATTLE BREEDERS AND DEALERS. BY J. H. FKAXD8E.N. Distrusted February 1, 1915. LINCOLN, NEBRASKA

COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURE AGRICULTURAL EXPERIMENT STATION THE EXTENSION SERVICE THE GOVERNING BOARD. HONORABLE WILLIAM G. WHITMORE, President, Valley. HONORABLE PHILIP L. HALL, Lincoln. HONORABLE VICTOR G. LYPORD, Falls City. HONORABLE FRANK L. HALLER, Omaha. HONORABLE EDWARD P. BROWN, Davey. HONORABLE JOHX E. MILLER, Lincoln. THE UNIVERSITY OFFICERS. SAMUEL AVERY, Ph. D., LL. D., Chancellor. E. A. BURNETT, B. Sc., Dean. College of Agriculture, Director of K ment Station. J. S. DALES, M. Ph., Financial Secretary. EXTENSION EXECUTIVE STAFF. C. W. Pugsley, B. Sc, Director. A. E. Anderson, A. B., Farm Demonstration Work. Mabel Daxieis, B. St., Home E<onomics. Hcldah Peterson, Boys' and Girls' Clubs. Emma Rked Davikson, ~Wo)r,en's Clubs. Prank C. Dean, A. B., Agricultural Editor. THE EXTENSION COUNCIL. HUOI O> IIPUTMKTI JMead Wilcox, Ph. D., Agricultural Botany. W. Upson, Ph. D., Agricultural Chemistry. W. Chase, M. E., A. E., Agricultural Engineering. A. Burnett, B. Sc, Animal Husbandry. IH. Gain, M. D. C. Animal Pathology. H. Prandsen, M. S. A., Dairy Husbandry. .whence Bruner, B. Sc, Entomology. A. Kiesselbach, A. M., Experimental Agronomy. C. Pilley, A. M., Farm Management. W. J. Morrill, M. For., Forestry. Alice Loomis, A. M., Home Economies. R. F. Howard, A. M., Horticulture. P. B. Barker, A. M., Instructional Aiironomii G. A. Loveland, A. M., Meteorology. H. E. BRAnFonn, A. B., Principal. School of Agricultun UNI MaiHTI OF TH< UN>VI»IT.<

tECTORY OF NEBRASKA DAIRY CATTLE BREEDERS AND DEALERS. Ill mpMH to the aft-repeated inquiry. "Where can I pur chase dairy cattle," the Dairy Department of the University of Netkaaka 1 1 ; : s prepared the following directory. K (Torts hare been made to secure (lie MUM of each and every dealer and breeder af dairy cattle in the State. The names of breeders of lM>th ]>ui-w}>red and giaaV. stock bare keea liste<l so that the farmer wlming to l>tiy pate Weal sires or cows of reeogaiaed ability to produce may have the opportunity of a varied selection. I Since the Department has secured the names of breeders and Icrs largely by correspondence, it does not vouch for nor reo - menil any apeeial one above another and would suggest that sonal investigation be made before purchaaiag. An earnest irt was made to list every breeder in this State. Some names e doubtless lieen omitted because of the failure of persons to pond to our inquiries or because no information concerning 'ir stock was available 1 . In spite of this, it is the most complete cctory of dairy cattle breeders and dealers ever published in s State and as such it should be a step in the i-i«ilit direction. Ity an examination of the maps in the directory, one can see at a glance the numbers which represent dealers and breeders in any given locality. Ity referring to these numbers in the direc - tory, the name and address of each dealer and breeder may be found. Nebraska is "coming into her own" in the dairy business, 'ith the steadily increasing prices of land and feed stuffs, farni - s are beginning to realize that dairying is one of the solutions f successful farming. It is with this idea in mind that the >airy Department of the 1'niversity of Nebraska wishes to be of hatever assistance it can to the farmers of the State in aiding lem to secure a better class of dairy cattle. The Department's esire is to promote closer cooj>eration between our dairy breed - 's and prospective purchasers of dairy cattle. The Department ill gladly give such information as it may possess concerning iv dealer and. whenever possible, will reader assistance to any - k> desiring to build up a better dairy herd. t Credit is due Messrs. E. D. Comstock, Jr., and H. R. Campbell for ful and conscientious assistance in compiling this directory. EXTENSION BUL. NO. 2«, AGR. EXP. STATION OF NEBRASKA. ItY I. H. FRANPSEN.*
